required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prepared Parents Helping Kids: Teaching Health Care Navigation for Bhutanese Parents

brief_summary.textblock:
Learning to navigate the US health system is challenging for many new immigrants. This pilot study will determine whether an intervention to teach parents key skills needed to access health care for children is feasible and acceptable to immigrant parents.
This study will also look for evidence of efficacy to inform the planning process for future, larger evaluations of the intervention (i.e., estimate effect sizes).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects enrolling in study and completing study visits
primary_outcome.description: Enrollment of the target sample and completion of the planned study visits by participants

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in retainment of health care navigation skills from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Health Care Navigation Inventory (HCNI) Skills Subscale scores from baseline to post-intervention study visits. Scores can range from 12 to 60, with higher scores indicating better outcomes.

clinical_study.condition: Immigrant Caregiver Health Care Navigation for Children

arm_group.description: All enrolled caregivers and parents will partake in the group-based educational intervention.

intervention.description: The group-based educational intervention will use a bilingual Community Health Worker (CHW) who will teach parents key skills needed to access health care for children. Parents will be invited to attend 6 small, closed-group sessions held over 12 weeks and lasting no more than 75 minutes. Sessions will be interactive, culturally-appropriate, and held in parents' preferred language.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult age 18 years or older
- Parent of a child <18 years
- Nepali-speaking
- Resident of the US for <10 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled to move away from the study location (e.g., to another city) before the end of the 6-session intervention
